page.title: 01Review Of Birnie Area.
page.content: The block lies 1km south of Elgin situated near the Moray Firth ,in the shadow of the Grampion Mountains.This area has a mild climate. Topsoil,blown by the prevailing westerly winds, causes sandstorms in dry periods. The land rises to 100 metres above sea level. Much of the area is coniferous. There are 10 farms averaging 300 acres, dairy or mixed. There are no shops or villages in this area, Birnie Church being the most important building. In the south west corner is the Longmorn Distillery with its long disused railway. To the west of the block and running north is the River Lossie which is prone to flooding.The banks are covered with bracken and rough grassland.
